Reviews.Title: “Really cheap-- in all senses”
Reviews.Author: Spiii-Rose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago in a charming old world room with high ceilings but this time I was in a tiny room with a tiny window. There was no stopper to be able to use the tub or the bidet (but a nice cleaning lady was able to find me one). The faucets didn't close properly either. Pretty dumpy. I asked at the desk and those old rooms do exist but not for those who pay the cheapo price like me. So I guess you get what you pay for... or less! It is well located but there a probablly more than a hundred hotels in that area, so there is choice to be had.

Reviews.Title: “With Asturias - You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony N
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the Asturias twice in two different years and I would stay there again. The hotel is basic but I have stayed in much worse places. The rooms are warm and there is little or no air conditioning. On the plus side, in the rooms I stayed in - The views from the balcony were terriffic. This hotel is smack bang in the city Centre and for the price you won't get anywhere better. The rooms I stayed in had the shower and bathroom within the room, or en suite as they call it - (as opposed to a communal facility on each floor). Very clean and well looked after every day. The breakfast is in a first floor dining room, accessable by a winding staircase. The fare on offer was pretty decent - I don't remember having a fry but there was cerial and plenty of bread and fruit/vegetables and eggs on offer. All together - the dining area is clean, bright and the service is really very good. The bar in this hotel is tiny. It is about 12-14 feet long and is poorly stocked by UK or Irish standards. But then again - You are in the centre of one of the most exciting and vibrant cities in the world - What are you doing in the Hotel bar? Overall I give this 3 stars because it is an old and basic place. For myself, when I am away I only really want to see the hotel for sleeping and washing. If this is what you are after - The the Asturias is more than well-enough equipped to meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: 19Alin91
Reviews.Content: As I was looking for a quite cheap hotel I was very satisfied with my choice: The double room was not the most modern one, however it was quite big. The bathroom was nice and clean. Regarding breakfast the variety of food and drinks could be improved, the service was good. All in all a very lovely budget hotel in a great area with loads of shops and good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location but noisey”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline2011
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews before booking and was unsure of what we were getting into. However, as other reviews noted, the hotel is very centrally located and close to the Sol metro station which made is really easy to get around. It was easy to get to and from the airport via metro as well. The hotel does not have air conditioning, which is not uncommon in Europe. We slept with the windows open and fan going which was fine temperature-wise, however, the street noise, sirens and helicopter noises went on pretty late into the early morning. I am not sure whether the amount of noise is normal or due to the street demonstrations going on that weekend. We had a room facing the main road with a small balcony. I found the hotel room rather large for a European hotel and it was clean. If you are going to Madrid to party and sight-see, I found it to be a great price and location. However, if you are going to get some rest, I would stay somewhere else. The elevator is small (only holds 4 people at a time) but we were lucky enough to only have to walk up the stairs to the 4th floor twice (and without luggage) instead of waiting. Also, the wake-up call worked the first morning but the second two mornings (including the day we had to get to the airport) we did not receive our wake-up call. The staff was friendly but did not apologize. They just said it was programmed and they would have a technician check it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!...”
Reviews.Author: Rexruff
Reviews.Content: I´m not sure when this hotel was built, but it´s best days were probably more than 50 years ago. It´s looks nice from the outside and is very well located, but inside.... The room was very basic, the tv didn´t work at all, and the shower was so weak it took ages to get wet. We asked to see another room, but it faced inward and seemed very stuffy, so we stuck with the first room, which at least had a street view. You can spend most of your time in Madrid waiting for the hotel lift to arrive - it´s lonely and inadequate for this size of hotel. On the positive side, the breakfast was good, the bathroom nice and modern, and we only payed 54 euros as a last-minute deal. And the location is perfect for the night-life.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here in the summer”
Reviews.Author: pitufala
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend at this hotel and it was very basic hotel but clean and safe. The location is excellent, very central but the big drawback was that the hotel has no air conditioning so in the summer it is too hot and stuffy, there are fans but we were given a room that faced the patio so no air ran through. I did get a glimpse of the rooms facing the street and the balcony rooms looked much better so if you can get one of those they are very nice. The other thing was that the the tv remote did not work and frankly the staff attitude was very cool and they did not care at all just saying that most rooms did not have any remote so it was a positive thing that we even had one which did not even work. It does need a renovation but all in all if you can get a good price it is very central and clean the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: BulkosFinest
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stag do and stayed in Asturias. Location is 10/10. Rooms are very basic, but it is 2 star!!! No aircon, and was 35c at night! But as we were drunk so this wasnt an issue, it is noisy from the street below, the partying stops at 7am, then the clean up begins, bin men, street sweepers etc so its always loud. Staff are fine, the lady behind the bar was a good laugh, although the 2 blokes were a bit more serious, although always helped when needed. Cheap and cheerful,

Reviews.Title: “good location but so hot”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: It had a very central location was close to everything, all within walking distances. Yet the pictures on the website that I had booked on were not what the hotel looked like. This hotel defo needs a makeover. You get what you pay for. There was no air conditioning in the room(we had booked a double room and got 2 twin beds instead) just one small noisy fan and trying to sleep when it is 32 degrees outside with no air conditioning is not good. Staff were not very friendly and only for the good location I do not have mush positive views on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I get what i paid for (2 Stars)”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlrgm
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best part is the location and only the location.. its literally a few seconds or minutes to everywhere Central in Madrid.. Cons: The worst hotel on the planet, the front desk receptionists are unfriendly. We got a room facing the street and it was noisy and with a very small bed. The picture i saw when i booked was a king size bed. When i complained about it, the receptionist mentioned that the full size bed is the standard or they put two single beds together to look like a king size bed. When i tried changing the room i was reminded by the receptionist that this is not an American hotel. Since its my 10th trip to Europe this i know that the beds are usually small,.. But can we start tipping these folks so that they have better customer service and attitude..We finally got a room in middle of the hotel (the hotel is shaped like a V). On the inside of the V, the rooms had nasty smell. It rained the first 2 days we got there and the smell was coming from a gutter inthe middle of the hotel grounds. We had to go to El Corte Ingles and bought candles to take away the smell..Last but not least is the constant noise coming from the hotel. The Hotel needs a complete makeover, rooms, beds and TV.. They have the nerve to still use what looked like a 13 inch TV in most of the rooms...a 19 inch would have been fine..not that we watched TV anyway!! Again go only for the location, otherwise choose elsewhere.. I recommend complete demolition and rebuild... Lesson learnt with 2 stars in Europe!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Could be much more than a 2star hotel with some work”
Reviews.Author: victorfds
Reviews.Content: The best of the hotel is the location. Very well located near Sevilha & Sol metro station. The room was clean and small. There was no water pressure in the bath which would be a trouble for one with long hair! The elevator is limited to 300kg so to say 3 adults with luggage. And with large groups staying at the hotel, be prepared to often climb the stairs. I've stayed two nights at the hotel on the 6th floor and could take the elevator 3 times... Did not try the breafast as there was plenty of possibilities around. The staff at the desk was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rob3770
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Valentines week and loved the location as it was right in the heart of the city. Plaza Mayor is a short walk away as well as Sol metro station. The rooms are a little small but clean, the high double balcony doors only shut at the bottom which can be an issue in the winter. There must be a night club down the road as a little noise can be heard up to 5-6 in the morning. One issue is with the shower, it's wall mount is facing width ways so unless you get the curtains just right you will end up paddling in the bathroom. The lift is small but big enough for two people with luggage so no issues there. The breakfast is a mix of differing pastries in wrappers, jam, cereals, orange juice and tea or coffee. Again quite adequate and filling. We found some bars to be expensive IE €7.50 a pint but if you find a Ham Museum (yes you read it correct) there's lots around, a beer costs €1 with tapas also €1. All in all a very nice 2 star hotel the i would happily return too.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located midrange hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandr550
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a very short time, only one night, because we had just to spend a night in Madrid between our flights. Arrived late and left the hotel early in the morning. We chose this accommodation due its convenient location right in the city center and close to Plaza Cibeles, from where buses run to the airport around the clock. Moreover we booked it with a significant discount through one of the hotel booking websites. Hotel`s own website didn`t offer such attractive rates. Our rate did not include breakfast and we didn`t need it due our early departure. Therefore we couldn`t evaluate their breakfast although I know that hotel provides it and has a restaurant. The most remarkable feature for me during stay was the building itself, its impressive architecture. There were long winding corridors inside. The main elevator was out of order that night and we had to use a spare one, very small and old. Our room was ordinary, nothing special and required some refurbishment. Just two beds and a bathroom, clean and fresh linen - everything that is essential for a one night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Shannon B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty nice. The location was great! The hop on hop off bus stop is just a short walk away! The hotel is fairly nice, although some things look worn out ( stairs clearly worn by traffic, some chippy paint , etc.) We had a little balcony looking out over the side street that I thought was pretty nice. We did not pay very much for the hotel so I was quite satisfied. What it lacked in looks it made up for in location! One odd thing was that our headboard was about the size of a king size bed...but our bed was double at most :P and quite wiggly on its legs!!I thought it was on wheels at first haha! If you are getting there by metro, best to get off at Plaza del sol rather than Sevilla(even if its on Sevilla street) . It is just follow Calle Mayor in the same direction as traffic, it takes you right to a little square and to your left, across the road is Asturias hotel :) Very crowded areas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ellulfelice
Reviews.Content: Excellent location ...close to everything in Madrid.....very large rooms with all basic needs......i would rate it a 3 star not 2 as it says....only complaint was that all the receptionists have a big difficulty to smile and welcome guests. The restaurant people were very nice. I would definitley recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Center of the city..”
Reviews.Author: Manasi K
Reviews.Content: It is located in the center of the old city area...very close to Puerto del sol...If you are coming from Train station PTA.ATOCHA, then I think Metro will be a better option compared to the bus... Well the location of the Hotel is fantastic, but the Hotel is quite old...they have maintained it OK, but the feel you get is that it is a old building....the rooms are spacious with lockers provided but it can hold only Cash or your passports not your laptops....they provide paid internet, so its not very nice... The staff is good mannered, English speaking but not very enthusiastic to receive guests & do not give any additional good useful info apart from what is asked.....It is quite close to the bus stop of bus 150 which will take you to Real Madrid stadium...they have a bar downstairs but I did not see it to be functional for guests...It is located very close to the Puerto del sol area which is the most crowded & happening place to be in the evening, so if that is the criteria & jsut need a place to keep luggage and come back to sleep then this is a great Hotel as it is strategically located...So all and all I would say its a OK OK Hotel....

Reviews.Title: “expensive”
Reviews.Author: aminephily
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel back in september 2008 ,I found it on hotel search.com after I check the pic and reviews i liked it but the reality wasn't as expected for that price $150 a night I could have better hotel for that price .the good thing is located right in the center of Mdrid next to the most attractions ereas

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Starstriker
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay in a central location and are prepared to sacrifice a bit of comfort and all the frills then this is the hotel for you! Very basic, cleanish but tired rooms and a bit noisy - only due to the excellent location very close to the main squares etc. All in all a great base to see the sites of Madrid but not a place to spend much time in.

Reviews.Title: “very nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: aliusik
Reviews.Content: For people who choose a budget and central hotel to visit the most important parts of the city. The continental breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: competent_one
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel who treats people like royalty! The first thing we loved about it was the location: we walked to everything and although we are sensitive to noise, we could not hear any traffic noise until we stepped outside! Second, the free breakfast was awesome! Although Europe is knows for its "coffee and a pastry" breakfast habit, this hotel was conscious of its international travelers and catered a full breakfast. The third - and probably the best, in our opinion - was the wait staff. TRULLY INCREDIBLE! We showed up for dinner one night 10 minutes before the hotel's restaurant was due to close. So, the wait staff served us, then sit down and entertained us with stories while we ate our meal! It was FABULOUS! We learned so much about the area... what a great impression to make on your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy and old”
Reviews.Author: Jamsimsafc
Reviews.Content: Advantages - it is situated in a very lively area of Madrid, close to Gran Via, Puerta de Sol, many restaurants, bars, clubs. Disadvantages - it is very noisy, has got old furniture, no air conditioning, no hair dryer. The wifi is very expensive - €6/hour or €12/24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but the rooms can be very warm bcuz it has not got aircondition. Wifi are expensive and no hair dryer also”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good but needs improvement such as airconditioned room, free wifi and a hairdryer

Reviews.Title: “Central location but you won't get a wink of sleep!”
Reviews.Author: EWC526
Reviews.Content: Great location but noisy and very hot...no AC and no cross breeze. The room gets very stuffy and it's impossible to sleep with the windows open because of the noise....you will hear motorinos, cheering, screaming, and the liveliness of Madrid until 6 AM. I would say this is the noisiest location in which I have ever stayed, and I live in NY! Other than that, it's worth it for the location and it's very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but expect sleepless nights!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for money and situated with easy access to all the major sights. We didn't have to use the underground once to get to all the places we wanted to go. Room facilites were below average with old fittings and furniture. Our curtains wouldn't close but fortunately we had wooden shutters as well. The hotel is situated on a busy thoroughfare with lots of street and traffic noise well into the early hours of the morning. Perhaps if we had an inside room it might have been quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: barteque
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Madrid, sorrounds with a lot of good tapas bars like Museo del Jamon, prices better than breakfest in hotel. If your room will have windows on the street you will hear all the night big noise. You can visit almost all of the most important things by foot. I was 5 days and I need subway only to go to the airport

Reviews.Title: “great location shame about the aesthetics”
Reviews.Author: StockportStueey
Reviews.Content: if you want to stay in a rather scruffy looking" broom cupboard" but being right in the heart of Madrid is your priority, then this hotel is for you. when we arrived we were shocked at how scruffy this hotel was and the room was tiny. having read the reviews on here about the noise we decided to request a room away from the road noise which they did accomodate. the draw back of this was we were given an inside room with the worst view of dirty grey walls and pipes.unfortunately we were still kept awake by the sound of rain dripping on the tiles outside or other residents having a party until 3.30am. this party was broken up by reception staff once we had complained. although the decor was dated and old the hotel was very clean. the staff were polite and helpful but seemed quite surly. the breakfast was continental style and was very basic with no real variety. on the plus side the location was excellent and there were some lovely bars just outside the hotel. our favourite was the catedral bar which did great tapas and meals. the metro was brilliant and dead easy to use. we couldnt beleive how cheap it was and we regretted booking a taxi from the airport when we realised we could have travelled so easily for just 2 euros each. anyone looking to use the metro should do so as there are 2 stations, Sol and Seville about 5 minutes away from the hotel. i would recommend this hotel to a friend but would ensure they knew the facts. at the end of the day you get what you pay for and on a city break you dont tend to be in the hotel much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexsandro1
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, near all the most important landmarks and stores. The price was reasonable, it was really worth. We got an apartment in the back, so we were never bothered by any noise and slept very well. The breakfast was very good, but remember to ask for fruit and yogurt which is only served by request (not self-service). The only thing we didn't like was that the wi-fi internet connection was NOT free, and not very cheap. Besides, it only worked in the reception, even if you paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld3
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel. Great location, average rooms, a little over priced. Small elevator. Desk service wasn't friendly, but they did the job. I took a backpacking tour to a few other cities in Spain, then came back to Madrid. I booked a cheaper hotel in the same neighborhood upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... Just 2 minutes from "Gran Via"...”
Reviews.Author: realrv6
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel right in the center of Madrid... Walking distance from the biggest atractions of the city. I really liked the experienxe there... Low price.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah - what you pail for - and extra excitement....”
Reviews.Author: Seaplane
Reviews.Content: No problems upon arrival. Nice room with french balcony(305). But you get what you pay for and unfortunately a little extra. The doorframe and the door had long ago parted ways, so there where centimeters free at the bottom and at top - not only noise, but at safety problem should a fire occur. The floor were pretty slanty in front of the lift at the 2nd and 3rd floor. I am not normaly a security freak - but you get what you pay for . and some extra excitement ... PS Avoid paying for the breakfast (7-9 €) - it is lousy compared to the price. You can buy breakfast much cheaper/better 100 meter from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: HOLABALU
Reviews.Content: Fist of all, i feel that i must mention that it seems as though far too many people are forgetting that this is a TWO star hotel! If you're after a plush hotel, or even a 'little' luxury, then this hotel isn't for you. If the location is more important, as it was for us, then you cannot go wrong!! It's smack bang in the heart of Madrid, and very close to numerous metro stations. We used the metro that's actually linked to the airport - you cannot miss it. Although we had to change three times, it only took a total of half an hour, and cost two, yes, two euros each!! The underground system in Madrid is second to none, very safe and efficient, and easy to use. It would have cost us £56 if we used the shuttle bus! The staff at the reception desk could perhaps be a little more welcoming, but they were not rude in any way. Yes, the hotel is very very dated, tired in appearance, and could do with a huge makeover. But then i'm sure that would only just bump the prices right up, so what's the point. If you'd prefer a modern hotel, stay somewhere else, and pay more - simple! We were very unfortunate with the location of our room, room 106. I'd certainly say that if you can avoid the 1st floor, then try and do so. Ours was next to the kitchen, and around the corner from the restaurant. So as you can imagine, it was very noisy. Our view out of the window consisted of air vents, and the kitchen staff coming and going. We couldn't leave the window open due to this, the smell of food, and the constant noise of the air vents from the kitchen. So the room was very warm and stuffy. We stayed for three nights, and our room was cleaned every day to a high standard. We were provided with clean towels on each day. There's a tv in the room, and basic furniture. We literally used the room to sleep in, and to get showered and dressed. Yes, a view of the road outside would have been nicer, a quieter room would have been even better, but this holiday (3 nights stay) inc flights & taxes cost us £135 each, so say no more!! The location of the hotel cannot be faulted, various things about the hotel can be. If you remember that it's a two star hotel, and not Claridges, i really cannot see how you can be that disappointed. I will be returning to Madrid, hopefully within a few months. If i'm being totally honest, i'd probably pay a little bit more and stay in another hotel. This is only due to the noise, and nothing else. Madrid is a beautiful, amazing city - enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, average conditions”
Reviews.Author: OhadZ
Reviews.Content: located in the center, very close to a metro station and walkng distance from some of the citie's main attractions but verry basic facilities

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as what people make out”
Reviews.Author: kimberdragon
Reviews.Content: Went with my lovely woman and 4 our friends for a three day break £80 per couple for the hotel. Staff are decent enough and so are the rooms. Close to everything so you can walk most places or get the metro which is buttons and fantastically reliable. Great city, would defo go to Madrid again and staff in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: 506PIR
Reviews.Content: I suppose the heading says it all. Avoid staying in this hotel like the plague. I was drawn to it because of its position which is indeed very central and convenient. It is just a few meters from the Metro station and just five minutes walk from Sol and all other city attractions. But then again, this is the only positive thing I can write about this hotel. Right from the start, it was obvious that the staff were the 'bored and unhelpful' sort, where if one asks whether they can speak some English, you get an answer in Spanish and a look that could easily pierce one's heart...!! Just going through the moves would seem to be their motto and it seemed to me that they just couldn't wait to be off work asap. The room was bare. Strictly three pieces of cheap furniture: 2 shoddy beds, a dressing/TV table and a bedside table that if given to someone free of charge, he/she would decline to accept such outdated scrap in one's home. TV set seemed older than myself at 50 years. The bathroom was basic as one could expect with no basin and bath plugs meaning that to shave, one had to leave the water running all the time and could not make use of the basic necessities as one is used to. However, the worst was the noise from students..!! They arrived one afternoon and it was obvious that trouble was on its way. They shouted, screamed, yelled, banged on their doors and our door so many times that I had to get out in the corridor and yell louder than them in order to try and get some peace and quiet. Did they stop? No they did not. I went down to the reception desk to inform them that it was simply unacceptable to have forty unruly students shouting and banging in this as we deserved and had the right to decency and peace. They told me that they will speak to their mentor but in affect, they never did. When I could take it no longer, I once again confronted them myself and shouted over their noise in English which was obvious they could not understand and even tried to ridicule the fact that I was trying to quieten them down. The only humane solution at that moment was to get myself and my wife out for the afternoon and evening hoping that things would eventually quieten down. On our return around midnight, chaos was reigning supreme and the level of noise, banging doors, laughter and running around in corridors and over furniture (it seemed so) was beyond comprehension. We had to fly back the following day and we were looking forward for a decent few hours of sleep before our travelling but it was only to be so in our dreams... All night long the chaos continued on. Banging doors and walls. Loud laughter and pranks in the balconies that one had to close the balcony door in order to shut some din out. This in spite of no air-condition in the room but it was the better of two evils. Once again, I had to don some clothes and try to quieten this anarchy down. Their mentor heard me shouting and did come out but the students were too many for this teacher/mentor and they simply ignored him! Who cares about other guests, that they paid for some privacy and peace, that it is our right as guests to have responsible reception people bring this situation under control. The kids did not care, the mentor was hopeless and the hotel staff simply did not care.. This is far from proper service form the staff and they even tried to tell me that it was 'normal' and they could do nothing. Nothing I ask?!?! They were just not bothered to get into the lift and do their job. They were simply way too comfortable sitting on their fat bottoms to get up and warn these unruly kids that this was a hotel were guests pay to stay there and not a playground were they could romp, bang, shout and yell as if there's no tomorrow. We left early that morning (before 0500) mainly because I could not take it any longer. I'm used to disciplined persons, normal and understanding people and helpful staff. I am in the hospitality business and this would have never been tolerated by my staff or myself. Never, ever.. I wish I had paid more attention to other reviews on this hotel as before booking, I had noticed similar complaints from previous guests, especially on the rowdy students issue. However, I thought that it might have been a one off not knowing how wrong I was!! It is now obvious that this is a regular pattern and the hotel is used to house students from other areas and countries mainly because they get a very cheap deal filling in their empty rooms. No wonder the decor is lifeless and the furniture so rundown, lest the surdents will demolish it overnight. With this in mind, of course, this is not a hotel one wants to stay in for his/her holiday. If the operators had to be honest, they would rename it as a student hostel, a place where serious grown ups and paying guests should avoid. Yet, honesty seems to be a very scarce virtue nowadays and it is through these reviews that the majority of travellers and would be users can have a true and honest insight of what this hotel really is. We used it as a base, nothing more, nothing less. Whatever you read about this hotel, know one thing and one thing only - it is a place of old fashioned, outdated, redundant and rundown decor and an obvious lack of care, interest and knowledge of how to accommodate guests in a city such as Madrid. This hotel is an insult to a lovely city which throbs with life all day and night long. A city rich in history and culture that draws inspiration from men of chivalry so many centuries back. Madrid is a city of good food, excellent wine and plenty of Sangria. A city of colour and nice plazas, plentiful to be honest. The Plaza Major is a place to take in whether during the day or night - just take it all in but eat in the restaurants close to it as they are much, much cheaper. All in all, Madrid is a dream - a lovely dream. The obvious conclusion from my experience is that Madrid is a city where everyone should spend some time during his life. As for my conclusions on the hotel - this is the hotel to recommend to your worst enemies if you want revenge.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location.”
Reviews.Author: macca15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Asturias for 3 nights, excellent location for all sights, metro some of the best tapas and tavernas try the little back streets you won't be disappointed. We weren't expecting much for a two star hotel but the rooms are a bit of a let down, if the pictures are correct then someone stole the furniture from our rooms, the 1st night we were in the attic, we had a balcony but you would have to climb out the bathroom window to get on it and it was cold in the night two tiny single beds it wasnt very nice. The next day we asked to be moved they gave us a double there are only (10 doubles in the hotel) so you are likely to get a twin. This was better but still far from expected. The breakfast was fine staff seemed fine. Great for metro link to airport 2E. Cheap for city break and if it had been really awful we would have moved, so it depends what you are willing to put up with, no AC would be a real problem in summer. Its old, creaky and noisy. We were out mostly and we were usually drunk by time we returned so we slept.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but no A/C and noisy students!”
Reviews.Author: samb275
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty much as you would expect from any 2 star. Simple, but comfortable and clean rooms, of average size. Bathrooms ok, clean, tidy. We couldnt have a plug for the bath/sink/bidet for 'security reasons'. Also, on the second night of our stay (we stayed for 6 nights), a large group of Portugese students arrived and spent the first night thundering around the hotel, shouting to each other across the courtyard some rooms (including ours) faced out onto, broke the luggage scales and just made huge amounts of noise. After we and others complained, it did quieten down a bit, however the tiny lift in the hotel always seemed full of them, even when you had very heavy suitcases, they wouldnt walk down the stairs, they made you wait. Also, being july, it was extremely hot, and with no air conditioning, only a fan in the room it was quite warm. For myself it was ok, but for many i doubt they would be able to sleep. Where location is concerned - you couldn't ask for better! 5 minutes walk from Puerta del Sol, and then pretty much the rest of central Madrid was within walking distance! Also very close to Sevilla metro station - handy to have as it saved us a lot on taxi fares from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Akramdash
Reviews.Content: Asturias Hotel is very Basic, but that was expected from the 2 stars Hotel. The rooms are OK but not very comfortable, No Air conditioning , so the rooms are so hot in the Summer time. Breakfast was fine. The area is very noisy in the Morning time, especially that you will have to open the window for some fresh air. The hotel is fine and you get what you are paying for. I would recommend this Hotel for Budget travelers, but it is not a kind of Hotel that you can spend good time at.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: paradoxrey
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel online through another service that listed it as 3-stars. When I got there, I found out that it had no AC, no WiFi, even though a connection from the hotel was available and an elevator that's button was held on by packing tape. The staff was pretty hands-off. When my friend and I decided to check out the next day and go to another hotel, rather than argue as they normally do in Spain, they just let us go. It must happen often.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER”
Reviews.Author: ed_filho
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff, filthy rooms, poor breakfast. Location was good, though. A hotel to recommend to your worst enemies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: Had three nights herein March. It was very easy to get to from the airport on the underground. 3 changes but we picked quieter stations after studying the tube map. The nearest station is Sevilla and that is yards from the hotel. This cost 2 euros. Reception was fine and we were allocated a room on the 6th floor. We had a balcony and a wonderful view of the city. The safe cost 1 euro everytime you opened it. We really struggled to get the key out and wasted the first 2 euros. We called reception and he brought his own euro and did it. It was really stiff to get the key out. The lightbulbs were both blown over the bed and I left a note in very poor Spanish and they were replaced the next day. The lift held four people and at busy times like breakfast we used the stairs. Breakfast was what we expected.The waiters were very efficient with tea, coffee and juice. There was cereal, cakes, rolls, cold meat, cheese, croissants and jam. They were very busy at times with large school parties but still very efficient. We always had hot water, sometimes slow running and no sink plug. Clean sheets and towels. Friendly maids. There is a little bar but we didn't use it. They looked after our cases happily in a room beside reception after checkout which was up to 12 noon. The walls were thin and occasionally we heard other guests in the corridors. All in all a good break in a superb location. Just a couple of Madrid tips. The Prado, which is within walking distance shuts Mondays. The Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales opens at 10.30 with bookable organised tours. We were there about 10.25 and got on the 11.15 tour. When we offered our money we were asked if we were English and then admitted free on production of our passports because it was Wednesday! Good art collection but tours only in Spanish. The Cerveceria Magister, 5mins from hotel in calle del Principe 18, brews its own beer and you get a free tapas with every drink. Good tapas in La Tia Cebolla, calle de la Cruz, again 5mins from hotel. We had a lovely break. Wear comfy shoes, things are close but we still walked miles.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: Ciara024
Reviews.Content: Staff tried to change our booking on arrival and in general were extremely unhelpful on all levels. We had paid a deposit on this 2 months earlier. We had informed hotel that there was one less traveller, 7 instead of 8, some weeks before and had been assured that we would only be charged for 7. On checking out we were charged for 8. Other guests of the hotel made noise all night. Hotel did nothing. The cleanliness was less than adequate also. The location of hotel was the only thing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best by a long way”
Reviews.Author: robtrips
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Asturias in Madrid Saturday 21 February 2009. Reception seemed ok in terms of a sort of friendly service and in terms of it looking fairly presentable. When we got to our room however, it was a different story. Though the room was clean, it was sadly lacking any form of comfort. The room was cramped, needed a good overhaul with at the very least a lick of paint. We discovered we had a balcony, however, the glass dividing screens between each of the balconied rooms was smashed or broken. Not good, not safe. The bedding was clean enough for sure, but the bedcover was a nylon throwback from the 70's and didn't look too new or fresh. Bathroom, functioning - just, but no plugs to put into the sink, bath or bidet so no choice other than to keep the water running. It was extremely difficult to turn off the taps fully - you had to use a towel to get a strong grip on the taps to turn them off fully! Shower was over the bath and pretty well ineffective with a distinct lack of truly hot water, The towels were shabby and torn, damaged floor tiles and a lump of concrete by the loo where they obviously didn't have any tiles left to fill the gap. The hotel was like a rabbit warren and difficult to navigate for a couple of days because of the layout. Breakfast was fair for a continental breakfast but if you had dentures you would not be able to eat the very hard baked bread roll you are served every morning. The food quality was not up to much with a blood red jam that looked most artificial and unappetising, really awful orange juice and mediocre cooked meat and prepacked croissants that looked and tasted nothing like a fresh one. The breakfast was the same every day and on the last day I couldn't face it again so went elsewhere to eat. Noise was a problem, from students, football fans, doors being slammed shut in the small hours, lift being kicked because it had failed one more than one occasion. It was a base, nothing more, nothing less. This hotel was advised via a reputable organisation as being 'mid-range'. It most certainly was not mid range by a long shot, more a place of tired, jaded, faded grandeur and a distinct lack of care or interest as to how they accommodate their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Basic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Willy2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Asturias Hotel last December for 2 nights. Location is absolutely great : In less than 10 minutes you can walk to the Puerta del Sol, La Gran Via, Plaza de las Cibeles, etc. Great selection of restaurants all around the hotel. Bus stop across the street and Metros station in 5 minutes. Great Tapas and Cervecerias restaurants all around . Reception staff was friendly on my arrival and all the time. There is Wifi internet in the room for an additional 10 Euros per night, which is ok. The lift worked ok, but is extremely small, and hardly 4 persons can fit on it. The rooms have good size, but the furniture looks old. There is a small TV also . The bathrooms have been upgraded and are actually better than the room itself. Heating in the room was working , but any way the room was a bit cold. The Breakfast is good but basic. The restaurant is a big area, and the breakfast includes juice ( not natural ), coffee, bread , cheese and ham. I requested a taxi to the airport, and the front desk called it with no problem ( be aware that a taxi to the airport is 45 Euros ). If location is a priority for you, this is an excellent choice, but expect a basic and old room.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: AST82
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Asturias Hotel in July for 3 nights. The hotel is very basic. I chose this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor, I was after something cheap but in a central location. This was our first trip to Madrid so we wanted something central as a base to travel from as we didn’t plan on spending much time in our room. The room was sufficient but it was really warm, bare in mind it was 38c outside and there was no AC or Fan in the room. I did ask for one on the second night but it never arrived. The staff were friendly but did not speak that much English. The hotel is slap bang in the middle of puerta del sol. The nearest tube stop is roughly 200 yards away. Outside there are plenty of places to eat and drink. Overall the hotel is ok as a base but I wouldn’t recommend staying there if you want to spend a lot of time in your room. The hotel does have its own shuttle service to the airport for 20 euro’s (I think) which was handy for going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.....”
Reviews.Author: Vixp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for several of the main tourist spots, Puerto Del Sol and great bars and restaurants minutes away. Easy to reach from the airport, especially if using public transport. Get a tourist travel card (gives you unlimited travel on all modes of transport – can be bought at the airport). Nearest metro is Sevilla – as you step up from the station keep walking straight ahead, you can’t miss it. If you want to get a ticket for the open bus tours, these can be bought from the kiosk across the road from the hotel. Room and bathroom was a fair size, also had a safe deposit box. But as the room had no air con or fan we had to keep the windows open – as we were facing one of the main streets the noise from there was terrible! The walls of the hotel were covered in a sort of dust residue which left white marks on anything leant against them. Only 1 lift which is very small, very old and very slow, trying to call it at certain times of the day was impossible! Staff at front desk were helpful and friendly. The staff at breakfast came across as abrupt, unfriendly and unhelpful. The breakfast was the worst I’ve ever had anywhere. Consisted of a pre-packed tasteless croissant and a bread roll – this was so hard I could have built my own house from them! You also get a slice of cheese and meat each too. Had to beg for a refill of tea or coffee. The only good point to breakfast was they had a choice of 3 cereals you could help yourself to. If you’re looking for a fairly reasonable priced hotel in a great location this is for you. If you’re looking for luxury in a peaceful area then it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Stag Do Base”
Reviews.Author: LukieG
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from here on my mates Stag Do (Nick Cumberland) and i booked 3 tripple rooms and 2 twin rooms. I wouldnt stay here if i was going on holiday as the rooms were basic and there is no AC - but there is a fan, which was never off. There was one cocky guy on the desk, but generally they were good. Location was good, walking distance to loads of bars and not too far from the darker side of Madrid. Would reccomend it to anyone who isnt going to spend too much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Earplugs's the word”
Reviews.Author: Norag51
Reviews.Content: The Asturias is at once blessed and cursed by its location. Hovering above one the hubs of Madrid, it is very close to the action but so close that sleep, without earplugs, is virtually impossible. Madrid doesn't sleep; and so don't you. The breakfast is shabby. A piece of bread is deposited each morning in your plate, a piece so hard and dried up that we felt at the retreat of Monte Cassino. The livery men insist upon providing the service but you can count on parching your due before your glass will be filled up. On the redeeming side, there is at least one person ( maybe more?!) on the staff with almost impeccable english and that might prove very helpful if, as in my case, circumstances go dire ( I was robbed of everything by a pickpocket).

Reviews.Title: “Asturias Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manchoy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before, so was a little surprised at some of the reviews on this site. I can only say that you get what you pay for- If you book on the cheap via an internet agency, don't expect any luxuries. I booked through my local bucket shop, which I have used for many years, and I trust them. My booking for the last week in July 2008 was with flexibletrips.com, part of Thomas Cook. The holiday was for 7nts, room only, plus flights from Bristol to Madrid, quoted as 'double/twin individual use standard, room only', and came to £568.94. Travel insurance not included. The first impression was good. Although I travelled on my own the room had three single beds ( could have had some great parties... ), plenty of room, the door opened into a short corridor with the bathroom on one side, and the main room at the end. At the other end of the room was a narrow balcony big enough for two or three chairs, although there was only one in the room. It was an outside room, on the fifth floor, and the view from the balcony was mixed cityscape/rooftops, and some outstandingly detailed architecture not completely visible from the street level. The antics of the binmen during refuse collection is well worth seeing! The fifth floor rooms only have a metal roller style shutter plus glass doors, which only dampen the considerable street noise a little. The last time I stayed was on the third or fourth floor, I seem to remember louvred outer shutters, glass doors, solid wooden inner shutters, and a thick curtain, when I closed all these the street noise was completely gone. The hotel has no air conditioning, and no fans, ceiling or otherwise. I don't recommend staying in Madrid during July full stop, now I know how hot it gets- up to 104F, with no letup at night untill well after midnight, but if you must then go out and buy a deskfan. I managed to get one for 10 euros, completely justifying staying at a budget hotel. Just throw it away when you leave. The room was clean, as were the towels and bedding. I didn't try the food, as I was booked in as room only, and wanted to eat out as much as possible. The location of the hotel helped in this matter, there were several bars & restaurants available without even crossing a street. To address a problem raised by another reviewer about charging camera batteries, I use a travel charger, the mains plug can be changed to suit the location, and I was able to plug it into the shaver socket in the bathroom. Or if you can bear to be without TV, plug in there instead. Spanish TV is crap anyway. A music channel would have been nice. Not that you would hear it over the noise from the street, and the heat from a TV set in July... In short, a good budget hotel to stay at when the weather's not too hot, providing you have paid for a decent room. Get a twin or double room, on the outside, on the third or fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it great location”
Reviews.Author: perfect21
Reviews.Content: After hearing the reviews on this site i was a bit worried. However the hotel was really clean there were no poblems, the rooms were a little smaller than i had thought they would be, but my friend and i only wanted to sleep in the hotel at night and be out all day!! so it was perfect. The view from the window was awfull tho, but we could cope with that. we hinted that it was too hot in the rooms and when we got back we had a fan. If your room is at the back of the hotel its really quite. Also the people at the desk spoke a little english. The best thing was that the hotel was open 24/7 so you can come in at what ever time. Also there are some really good irish bars opposite the Pueto del sol called the dubliners and o'connells if thats what you like. they are good for meeting all nationallities!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude service, didn't honor reservation.”
Reviews.Author: foxsmjr
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel using Kayak.com, and made the reservation thru a third party website. The reservation stated a "double room, double bed". When I arrived, they gave me a room so small, and the bed was barely as wide as my shoulders. I went back to the front desk and said there was a mistake. The manager told me that was all that was available, so I could take it or leave... i left and went to the Hotel Victoria, 2 blocks away. From what I saw, the room was worn, dirty, and unkept. I wouldn't have stayed if if the double room was available. Be prepared for a headache if you book here!

Reviews.Title: “Good... but no longer than 3-4 nights”
Reviews.Author: J3R3MIE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a two star, smack in the center of beautiful Madrid for a cost of 100 - 130$ a night... cant expect luxury! For tourists travelling to Madrid for a few nights only I definatly recommend for its location ! You cant get lost it is the central point of Madrid! Very good when you come back from a late spanish night. Reception was ok.. rooms were ok... Noise was BAD, Beds were BAD. A week no thx .. 2-3nights to have a little stop in Madrid : Definately

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: pooled
Reviews.Content: Yes I know it's cheap, but the place is not just tired, it's exhausted! I also agree with others comments about the poor breakfasts and staff lack of interest. The first room I had was damp and next to the lift shaft so not only do you hear every footfall, every door bang but all the traffic from the lift. They very willingly changed my room to a "quiet" room at the back but this has almost no natural light and was next to an adjacent buildings faulty aircon and over the delivery bay and smelled of toilet drains. The worst thing though was that there were about 4 large groups of children staying who were left literally unsupervised at night, (the teachers went out for hours!) and in their bored state, they resorted to randomly banging on doors and telephoning rooms til after midnight. The reception staff were totally disinterested in other guests welfare and seemed at a loss to know what to do, although I was told there are regularly up to 200 kids staying there this time of year. So if you don't mind noise, smells and rude kids, this might be worth the cheapness.

Reviews.Title: “Only suitable if you don't want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Lozseamstress
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel to younger travellers as the hotel is old and worn out and looks like a youth hostel. The rooms are tiny with old worn out beds and peeling paint and the noise from the street is horrendous! However if you are young, want to go out all night and want somewhere central to stay it is certainly in a good position in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, but don't expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine_Powell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great spot for seeing all of Madrid, with Puerta del Sol yards away and Plaza Major just a short walk. The staff at the hotel are quite helpful, especially the bar staff(!) but there were a couple of staff in the restaurant who were a bit less than friendly. The breakfast is slighlty disappointing, consisting of cereals that you can help yourself to, and a few pastries, but the rest is brought to the table and is mainly bread, processed cheese and a few varieties of ham. The coffee is adequate and the juice is more like squash, but is acceptable. The rooms were ok, and when one of our party was given a damp room, the hotel staff changed it without any fuss. We actually had a balcony with a great view of the street and the bathroom was fine too. It's not palatial, but then with the price that you pay, why would you expect it to be?

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a budget weekend”
Reviews.Author: EllieD17
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend in March with a Hen Party, and was concerned after having read reviews of the hotel. I was glad to discover when we arrived that the hotel was a lot nicer than described! The location was great - only about 5 mins from Puerta del Sol, about the same to Gran Via, and only 2 mins from Metro (though we didn't use it as we managed to get to most places easily on foot). There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area, and even a Haagen Dazs next door, and a Starbucks down the street! The little bakery next door was great for a late breakfast (hotel breakfast finishes at 11am - though we didn't always make it!!) or a quick snack. I wouldn't really say that the hotel was noisy, as we kept the windows (double glazed) and shutters closed. We didn't hear much noise coming from other rooms. The rooms were simple, but clean, comfortable and very spacious. We had rooms on the 6th floor, all of which were a good size, and some had large terraces (no outdoor furniture though, which would have been nice). The furnishings were simple, and fairly modern (pine beds), the beds soft and comfortable, and the TV did work, though we didn't spend much time in the room to watch it. The bathroom was clean, the towels replaced every day, and the shower always hot with good water pressure. My only concerns are that there is no air-con in the room, and in March it was already warm; and also that the safe in the room is a bit of a swizz - you have to put €1 in each time you want to open it. The breakfast was ok - we had to pay €8 per day, which was fine, but there are alternatives in the area if you don't want to take it. You get a slice of ham, processed cheese and processed meat with peppers in, a basket with cakes and croissants, a roll, jam, butter, coffee/tea, orange, and there are also cereals to choose from. A typical breakfast for a European 2* hotel. Finally, the staff at the hotel were always very helpful, kind and patient. They kindly allowed us to keep one of our rooms after checkout for no extra charge before our group headed home. I work in travel, and have stayed in many hotels of different star ratings in many different countries, and I have found many worse than the Asturias (even some 3 or 4 star hotels!!) If you are staying in Madrid for a few days, and you don't want to pay much for your room, and don't expect to get a 5* hotel when you're paying for a 2* - then the Asturias is a good choice. If you are more fussy, then Madrid has plenty of other hotels on offer. We were glad we chose the Asturias, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Neighbourhood for a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location a few feet from the Sevilla Metro stop and a five minute walk to Plaza del Sol and El Corte Ingles. Starbucks is located two blocks away. That is where the convenience ends. This hotel is a dump-no doubt about this. When I arrived, the hotel had paperwork all over the place-on the front desk and at the check-in counter. The hallways are in desperate need of a paint job-falling paint and scrapes all over the walls. The rooms are clean but they have the look of an era gone by-literally 1985 thereabouts. I asked if there was Internet and the front desk guy told me that he would not recommend it. There is a 50 Euro deposit to use the Internet plus a 20 Euro per day charge (I cannot even imagine what that means). There is a lock box in your room but you need a Euro coin to use it. How tacky... The rooms are noisy. You hear every toliet flush and the outside street noise is very load at night. The noise makes you jump out of bed every time. My room had a balcony but the balcony door did not lock. Upon checkout, the front desk was disorganized and rude on top of that for no reason whatsoever. I would not recommend my worst adversary to stay here. It is not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely "budget hotel".. not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: stargazer143
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay at Asturias. The building is old and in desperate need of renovation on the inside. The paint and wallpaper was old and peeling. While we got a good deal and a nice view of the city, the noise from the street was constant and extremely loud. The beds were cheap and uncomfortable, the sheets/bedding thinning and had holes, the pillows flat yet lumpy. The bathroom smelled very strongly of bleach. We had problems checking out, and the couple we were travelling with were overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- good price!”
Reviews.Author: pazitush
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel very convenient in its loacation. Stayed three nights (27-30 December) and returned again for one night in midst of january. Always ask for inner room (not facing the street). Staff were frindly though not much afficient. Breakfest moderate and rooms medium size and a bit old.. Still we think it was a good deal .

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ive stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: EllieOh
Reviews.Content: Booked this thru Booking, a site I constantly use and have a good experience of so far. I'm now sure that Asturias use this website to pawn off the worst rooms they have and can't sell any other way. Looked at the fire escape plan and we def had the smallest room in the hotel. Double bed was a 4'6 for 2 adults in a room the 10 x 8 feet maximum. On the website it states there are dressing gowns, hairdryers, web access, bidet, free safe deposit, international stations(CNN only).. Well they must have been hiding under the bed because we didnt see the likes of it Hot water for 1 night only of 3. Continental breakfast was easi singles and some processed pressed ham that must have included pigs feet because it was nasty!! The staff were cold and unfriendly. I would actually say abrupt to customers, I witnessed the attitude to more than ourselves. The cleaning staff had no consideration for visitors sleeping - cleaning of floors began approx 8.30 am. Their conversations went on between rooms The only redeeming factor was that it was central to the city centre. It was a shame as it did spoil our stay a little and the building was beautiful but dishevelled.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best out of season”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: My room was a very good size. Tiled floors and woodchip painted walls. The tv did not work -so what. The location is terrific beside Sevilla metro stn so only € 2 to get by metro all the way to airport. Great places to eat close by and very reasonable. No air con -so summer could be sticky. My concern is the left luggage room not supervised . Good for a few days but I would not recommend for a longish stay. Lots of hot water and loads of towels provided. Staff were friendly although I did not eat/drink in the hotel. Probably good for younger people

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It at All Costs: Poor Excuse for a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louloudaki
Reviews.Content: To summarize it in one sentence: Location is the ONLY thing going for it. I stayed at the Asturias for 3 nights early in October 2007. Despite having read the negative reviews on trip advisor, I decided to book with the hotel simply for one and one reason only: location. I was keeping my fingers crossed that it would rise above the negative reviews even for just a bit. Big mistake; don't do it folks. DO NOT , I repeat, do not stay at this hotel. There are other hotels near by, even one located half a block away. Try one of those, hopefully they'll do a better job. THE ROOM: mine was on the fourth floor and I had no problems with the elevator. The room was big enough for one person, but I cannot say the same for the bathroom. It was small and it had no bathtub, just a shower. It had no hair dryer as well, so ladies bring your own. Everytime I had to stand in front of the mirror I had to close the door behind me. The room has no aircondition, just a fan. This was ok with me as I was there in October, and it had cooled off significantly, but I can only imagine the furnace of a room it must be during the hot summer months. There was a small TV in the room but the picture was snowy and the remote never worked. THE BREAKFAST: ( or what they call breakfast at this hotel) .The tables were already set with food on them sitting there for hours. On each table were placed 3 slices of processed lunch meat of indefinite flavor, one slice of processed cheese -which by the time one managed to unwrap, there was hardly any left-, stale bread, a semi-stale croissant and two small cellophane wrapped sweets of no specific taste as well. The guests had to help themselves to a small table with a very limited selection of cereal. The waiters were there only to serve juice and coffee. THE HOTEL STAFF: They would not care less. They were very rude and acted as though they were doing the hotel guests a favor. When I requested a hairdryer, I was given one with an outlet for US use. When I called the receptionist to request a converter, I was simply told that she had no staff available to send me one with and that I had to get dressed , go downstairs and get the converter. When I called again, a different receptionist simply told me that there is no converter -period. The night before I was to leave, I requested a wake-up call, and also asked the receptionist to reserve a taxi for me. He simply told me that they do not reserve taxis and all I had to do is stand outside ( early in the morning with all the luggage, mind you) and flag one down!!!!! ( I have done a lot of traveling, but this was a first for me.) As for the wake-up call: it never came; no one ever bothered calling. I was lucky I woke up on my own. When I complained about it , the receptionist said nothing, took my credit card, settled my bill, turned her back to me and walked away!!!! Overall , it was NOT a good experience. Do not stay at this hotel folks.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey !!!”
Reviews.Author: BobNottsUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and had 5 sleepness nights at this hotel. Neither the inside or outside shutters worked and the glazing was single.The noise from the street was such we could not sleep properly. We were allocated three different rooms before getting one with a working shower. We asked for twin beds but in the end had to settle for a small double bed. The hotel is allegedly 2 star but fell far short of that rating. The breakfasts were less good than what we have come to expect in Spain. If this had been our first trip to Spain we would not be going back. Only insomniacs should consider staying at this hotel till they fix the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: upthewazoo
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were not expecting much. Actually we were terrified about what to expect. We had a room on the 4th floor. Very clean, no peeling paint. The linens and towels were changed daily, the floors were washed daily with disinfectant. The room was very pleasant with a view to the main street and side street. It is noisy, we asked for a fan and shut the shutters, glass doors and wood doors that are pushed into the wall and then we were able to sleep. Our bed was hard but I find most hotel beds are. I asked for extra pillows, propped them around me and was able to sleep. Front desk staff is helpful. Breakfast gave you 3 cereal choices, bun, coffee, tea, juice, meat, cheese sometimes packaged croissant sometimes fresh and if you asked for it they would bring you yogurt. It was fine to start our day. Plaza Santa Ana one block away became our favourite place. Not as crowded, more a local hang out. The restaurant by the playground with a railing around it has a great dinner deal for 11.50 euros and very friendly staff. Soup or salad, steak or salmon steak with potatoes and dessert. If you come across Fat Tony's restaurant on the walk to Santa Ana, the internet on a side street there is under 1 euro an hour unlike the internet in the plaza by the hotel for 2.5 euro a half hour. Look around. Look at Plaza Mayor, DO NOT EAT THERE. Major rip off, terrible food. (50 euros for rice with little seafood and chicken that was only bones.) Side streets with little restaurants are much better. Everyone seemed to have an english menu even if they spoke little or no english. Loved Madrid, Asturias Hotel was the best location for everything for what we paid for and received we were very happy. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would try another hotel, although location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelEurope66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in September. I previously read the reviews so my expectations were not very high. The hotel is in a fantastic location; right smack in the middle of everything. You can pretty much walk to all the major attractions. We asked for a room that did not face the street after reading about all the noise, unfortunately, there must have been a restaurant in the area so all night we heard noises from clinking dishes. The hotel is in desperate need of renovation; furniture looks like it dates back to the 50's, falling apart and couches that are missing cochins throughout the common areas. It's very unfortunate that the owners are not willing to inject some money into renovating the place because it is in a prime location. The room was clean, beds were ok, it's just that everything in the room was so old and runned down; the doors, the floor, the walls, absolutely everything. We did not look forward to coming back to this hotel every night. Even though the location was great, I would choose another hotel next time. I would say that this place is probably equal to some of the local Hostels in the area. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel prices for Hostel accomodations”
Reviews.Author: GutUpAndGo
Reviews.Content: I rarely write a bad review for the hotels I stay in because I understand that no place is perfect or without fault. As long as the hotel comes close to being worth what I paid for then I'm fine with it. This hotel did not do that. The size of the room was similar to that of a walk in closet. Having traveled much of Europe I often expect small rooms but this was just terrible. The beds were not the least bit firm. Very spongy mattresses that left you aching when you woke in the morning. It was quite warm being that it was roughly 80 degrees outside and we were in a cramped 4th floor room and we were told initially that we could not have a fan as they had none left. Eventually a fan was provided. There was no AC to speak of. Our 12'' television didn't work initially. I didn't mind so much since I don't go on holiday to watch TV but that may be something that some people take an interest in. There was zero water pressure in the shower and every room I saw (from peering in while walking down the halls) had an excessive amount of peeling paint/stucco on the walls. In addition to that, any of the stucco that wasn't peeling was filthy. In all honesty if I had paid 20-30 pounds a night which is what I would expect to pay for a hostel I would have no complaints at all. For that money I would have gotten what I expected. However, this hotel was more than double that and there was no way to justify that type of price. Silver lining? Good location and clean floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a great location”
Reviews.Author: trishwnottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Asturias from September 3-7 and were quite happy with our experience. We found everyone, including front desk staff, very helpful and friendly. Our room on the 3rd floor was basic, but clean and comfortable, though the beds are very squeaky. I had to ask at front desk for a hairdryer and we had to ring them to replace a broken glass, which they did immediately. The breakfast is basic but filling. The location of this hotel meant that we never had to use public transport over the four days we were there. We walked our feet off and saw all the main tourist sites and at night it was wonderful to know that wherever we went it wasn't going to be too far to walk home and drop into bed. We only became aware of the noise from the street in the early hours on our last night as we had to get up at 3am for an early morning flight. Other than that, we were far too tired for noise to keep us awake. If you think you would be, take earplugs. For the price and location, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...............”
Reviews.Author: diontiger
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay in the Asturias hotel in Madrid. We stayed for 5 nights and have to say it is not the most comfortable hotel we have stayed in! After booking the hotel through Expedia, I contacted the hotel directly to request a quiet double room and on arrival we were give a twin room at the front of the hotel which was very noisy - the beds were very hard as were the pillows and the whole thing was like sleeping on the floor! When we complained on arrival, we were told that we would have to wait until the morning to move us - which they did do once we had asked again at reception. Second room was better but the whole hotel is rather shabby - the towels were changed daily but they had seen better days. The bedding was not changed at all while we were there. Staff on the whole were okay but quite a lot of the staff did not speak good English and did not always want to help us, particularly when one of our bags went missing on the way to Madrid. Don't rely on the lift to get you to your floor either, at busy times the lift can take an age to get to you and you are better off using the stairs if you can. For the price we were disappointed with the hotel itself, but the location is fantastic as it is right in the heart of the old city and wihin a few minutes walking distance of the metro stations. You really do need to be able to speak some Spanish while you are there - not very many English friendly places/people. On the whole Madrid is a fantastic place to visit and I would recommend Madrid - just be careful which hotel you choose!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for a Stag Party”
Reviews.Author: Sotonsfc
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel the building looked quite impressive from the outside and it was right in the centre of Madrid cultured nightlife. When we got in our room we were on the 4th floor overlooking the central courtyard so we didnt have a view other then other rooms but this was quieter then the outside looking rooms. The room was very clean and our bathroom had been refurbished although the hot didnt work in our shower,although it was so warm a cold shower was perfect. I would suggest you ask for a fan when you check in because they are only a few and as you have no air con they are a life saver. In the summer the temperatures hit 40c and only a little cooler at night so rooms are like ovens. Two in our party had a room on the sixth floor and they discovered if you climbed through the bathroom window you had a cool terrace with one of the best views of Madrid.I personally would recommend this hotel for people on a budget or on a Stag or Hen,but deffinately not a long weekend with your partner as a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “excellent locatioin for its price”
Reviews.Author: Gerard-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Asturias from July 31 till August 3. Having read the previous reviews I wanted to find out myself and to be honest: It was a very nice stay. We had a triple room on the 4th floor which had room enough(and to be honest, what do you need a big room for if the only thing you do there is sleep). We had a good size bathroom. Our room was on the northside, looking out on a sidestreet and we had a big balcony/terras. There was no problem with noise at all, we hadn't had any problem with staff... you just need to do what the Spanish do and attract attention(or cut a cue if you need to). Station Sevilla is around the corner, station Sol en Puerte del Sol are within 5 minutes walk, busstop right in front of the hotel. Maybe we were lucky with our room, but calling the staff rude i would not. We didn't book breakfast because we were right in the center of the city with coffeehouses galore and we found one in Sol, a Jamaican Coffeehouse where we went every morning. All in all not a bad stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of my vacation”
Reviews.Author: bom-bo-head
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there in July. The people at the front desk were rude, and when we asked them questions (like where an all night pharmacy was, for example) it was obvious that they were annoyed to be pulled away from their conversations to have to actually talk to us. After we check in the man at the desk informs us that the elevator is broken, to go to the back and use the service elevator. No offer to show us where, no signs pointing the way. We found the service elevator, but when we got off on our floor (7th) we took a wrong turn (the service elevator lets you out in the service area on the top floor) and had trouble finding our way out of the laundry area to our room. Once in the room we realized it wasn't air conditioned. My hotel in Germany didn't have air conditioning, but Berlin in July is a lot different than Madrid. We were on the top floor with no attic above us so the tile roof soaked up the sun all day and put it directly in our room, plus the side of the building we were on received direct sun from 8am to 8pm. The room was an oven with only an table fan for relief. The window and terrace door did open, but provided very little air. At night it was unbearable, during the day we had no choice but to seek refuge outside, which was very hard since most business close from 2-4:30. During our stay the outside temperature was 101F, inside it easily hit 110-115F. I knelt down on the floor to pick something up, and the floor was warm to the touch. In desperation we finally pulled the mattresses off of the beds and dragged them out to the terrace to sleep. At night Madrid cools down, but this hotel would hold the heat until about 6 or 7am, and start to heat up again a little after 8am. It's apparent that this used to be a luxury hotel, but it is very quickly falling into disrepair. Walking down the stairs from the 7th to the ground floor (the elevator was touch and go) you could feel the stairs give, a little nerve wracking. Also, they advertise that there is a safe in the room, but they don't mention that you have to pay 1euro each time you want to lock it. Other than that, it was clean, no bugs, and had a good location. If you don't mind extreme heat, or if you are going during a cooler time of the year, it is a decent hotel for the money, just don't ask the front desk for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Danarty
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel located in a central good location near Sol. Rooms are small and in need of refurbishment. Air conditioning would have been good but we managed with an electric fan in the room. Staff were friendly and helpful. Don't take the wife or girlfriend if you want to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Much too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: No1Fox
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned, if you stay at this hotel do not get a room facing the (main) side street and do not stay on the first floor where the restaurant is unless you intend to return to your room after midnight. The bed was as hard as the floor. The best features for this hotel are: it has an excellent, bright bathroom, the desk clerks speak English well enough, Hagen Dazs ice cream is right next door, and Sol station is about a 5-minute walk. There are plenty of restauarants also within a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: astoltenberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and spoke english. The rooms were clean, just old. Bathroom was clean, shower had adequate pressure, not great. I asked about internet access and they said it was a 50 euro deposit plus 12 euro per day. I didn't get it as the ice cream shop close had free internet which I could sometimes pick up in the room. Bed was very soft, but the pillow was very flat. Sheets were clean. Noisy at night if window was open...but in very center of they city. Great location. Overall a decent hotel. Great location. Absolutely a great hotel if you want something a little more than a hostel. I probably wouldnt stay here again unless the price is much cheaper than the other hotels, which is why I stayed here this time.

Reviews.Title: “c'mon, it was what you paid for!!”
Reviews.Author: nics04
Reviews.Content: myself and 2 friends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights a couple of weeks ago - the may bank holiday weekend to be exact and had an absolutely brilliant few days...the hotel is perfectly fine it was what we were expecting and above average for the price we got it at - you cant beat 399euro between 3 of us for 5 days can you!! The room was clean and very spacious - it was just what we wanted - we didnt come to Madrid for a luxurious hotel we came to party! The room (212) had a balcony which faced onto the street...now it was quiet noisy at night (i had my earplugs!!) but its what to expect when you are smack bang in the middle of the city - and this city doesnt sleep! breakfast was included and it was fine - mediterranean - a lot of bread based stuff - but you could easily not have the breakfast and go elsewhere as there is plenty of nice places close to the hotel. You cant beat the hotel for its location - so close to everything and i found the staff to be alright - they were helpful enough to us anyway and recommended a fantastic authentic spanish restuarant 'Paella de la Reina' a must - only about 10 min walk away. Yes i would stay here again (not for the retiring type though!) you cannot beat the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay here”
Reviews.Author: SouthbanKMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was overpriced and horrible. The bed had a big slump into the middle, we didn't shower because it looked unclean.

Reviews.Title: “pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: ozintrepid
Reviews.Content: Wish that I had checked this site first. It is a pretty shabby place, and quite expensive for what it is.
