I wish that I had spent LESS - I feel that I would have got a cleaner, nicer room in a cheaper hostal. My main gripe was that the sheets had not been changed since the last guest and were very grubby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tulip57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with a small group of college students. Location is great for them, also because of a nearby Internet cafe. Rooms are clean, but very basic; exactly what we expected for the price. Front desk speaks English. Is okay helpful. If you are on a budget, this hotel is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Total rudeness at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Gereegon
Reviews.Content: We are two female friends in our late 50's traveling alone and when we arrived at the hotel, we were told they didn't show us arriving until the following day (I had paperwork to the contrary but they weren't interested in seeing it!!!). It was after 9:00 P.M., we'd just arrived from Paris and hadn't eaten since lunch, plus we were tired. We were informed the hotel was sold out that evening. When we asked if they could recommend another hotel for us to stay at, the answer was a rather rude "No" and that was it! We couldn't believe it. They never even tried to see if they could accomodate us elsewhere even though we were paid for 5 nights at their hotel. It left a totally negative impression on us. While the room itself was okay and the breakfast very nice, the location was extremely noisy and the front desk staff very rude. I would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Expect 2 star”
Reviews.Author: KR1970
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 women celebrating a 30th birthday for a long weekend in February. We paid for 2 star accomodation and that's exactly what we got. Each of our 5 rooms were different, some larger than others, some with a balcony and some with an interior view. The rooms/beds were clean on arrival and although we only stayed 2 nights we had maid service and clean towels on day 2. Reception staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was more than adequate, continental style. If you use your hotel just as a base for sleeping and changing in then the Asturias is fine, if you like to spend time in your room relaxing then I would stay elsewhere. The hotel is in a fantastic location and if that is your priority and you're on a budget then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Well we're going back!”
Reviews.Author: SamsCalling
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews on here we were quite apprehensive about going. My friend & I (both 21) paid £70 each for 4 nights here, including breakfast. It was meant as a cheap break away. The hotel has a fantastic location - you're about a 3-4 minute walk from Sol which has lots of bars, restaurants & shops. Metro access is everywhere....lots of bus stops....but this hotel is right in the centre. Our room was looking out onto three other walls - no view, but you may be able to get one looking onto the street. However, other people complain of noise though - we didn't hear any from our room so I guess they must mean the street! On our first night we went to bed at 1am & it was quiet as anything. The other 3 nights we didn't get back til 6-7am so I couldn't comment, lol! Although the hotel was noisy in the sense walls are very thin & if someones moving stuff upstairs, or checking out, the whole hotel hears it. Didn't try the breakfast as we were usually going to bed lol, but there's lots of cafes round, especially one a couple of doors down if you turn right from the hotel. Yes, the rooms are old, & so is the hotel...but I don't know, it has sort of a quaint feel & we didn't see what everyone was complaining about. We paid less than £20 a night, with breakfast....you get what you pay for afterall! Reception area was quite modern & clean & there was a bar, though we didn't get anything from here. I'd imagine it'd be very hot here in the summer as we always had to leave our window open. Can't complain about this hotel - we got it at a great price, you can't beat the location, staff are very helpful . We're staying there again in October! We love all the bars & clubs around the area, so we can't think of a better hotel. We used it as somewhere to get ready & sleep & for that it's great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: divingdiva
Reviews.Content: Great location close to shops and restaurants. The hotel is adequate and our room was spacious if dated. The bathroom was like stepping back to the 1970s with amazing floor tiles! The beds were comfortable although we had to make do with 2 single beds rather than a double. There is only one lift which takes a max of 4 people and obviously when everyone is wanting to check out at the same time of the morning there is a very long wait. We were on the 6th floor and on the Saturday the lift broke down which meant long hikes up and down stairs. Thank goodness we weren't checking in or out then! There seemed to be large groups of students staying at the hotel but this didn't cause any problems. I would just say though that if you get a room overlooking the street, take your earplugs! The noise was constant, despite double glazing and roller shutters...Madrid does not really come alive till very late in the evening and then seems to go on till at least 7am! Great for revellers, bad for those of us who want to sleep! However, overall, I would say the hotel is a good bet if you want to be close to all the amenities without paying a small fortune. If you are looking for luxury, don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: regtraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotels.com who are usually very good and i have never had a problems with before however this time they quoted that the hotel had a mini bar and a hair dryer in the room which it did not and when questioned with the extremely unhelpful reception staff i was advised this is not something they provide and never have! Before I booked this hotel I called to check they had heating as I feel the cold and wanted the option just in case, I was advised that every room has heating when I arrived I was frozen to the bone as it was cold and raining etc when I asked for the heating on I was advised that they do not think it is cold enough so I could not have any heating as it is controlled centrally! I explained I had checked before booking and their response was o well! Other things wrong with the hotel were rooms were dark and dingy with very little air, the toilet had a leak although fixed when I complained, the TV did not work again fixed once complained! Also I got bitten as the bed sheets had bed bugs. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel. Not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jwl2672
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Venere.com, which normally gave me great rooms throughout Europe. I am a very undemanding single traveller - all I require is a shower and a bed. I've been in hotel rooms with loud street noise, small rooms, leaky faucets, etc. etc. This is the WORST HOTEL EVER. I got here right after having my pocket picked at Plaza de Castilla train station (moroccans, one kicked and distracted me on the left and the other picked my pocket. I instantly grabbed the guy to my left but didn't see the guy who actually had my wallet. Cops had to let him go cause he was only a setup man and didn't have my wallet with 300 euros and all my cards - be wary!). The people working here are of college age and nice enough. They gave me the room and pointed me to the nearest AMEX travel office to get a replacement card. On checkout however, they nearly caused me to miss my flight because their credit card swiping system failed after 15 attempted swipes with errors. About the hotel itself - there was a student group staying here and this place was like a hostel. The walls are paper thin and I heard every single word on the radio playing next door. Had to bang on the walls to get them to turn it down. No power outlets at all in my room. Had to charge my camera battery in the manager's room while she was making out with her boyfriend. Rooms can barely fit the twin bed and your luggage. I would put the size at exactly two twin beds with no space left over. Window looked out into another building wall. The elevators are terrible - slow and manual. Summary - good people working there. Nothing else. This will ruin your holiday if you're under 22. By the way, don't confuse Hotel Asturias with Hotel Astoria (only a block away) - to my embarassment I went to the latter and the concierge kicked me out with disgust and relegated me to this dumphole.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel, must be one of the worst!”
Reviews.Author: anna22
Reviews.Content: really horrible hotel, do not stay there! Do not book ever through Expedia which gave grossly misleading information about this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: Peterh
Reviews.Content: The hotel occupies a striking corner pitch right in the centre of Madrid - 1 min - Metro (Seville Station), 5 mins Plaza Major, 10 mins Prado or Gran Via the location is superb. Taxi from Main railway station = 10 Euros – Airport = 20 Euros. Excellent shopping and restaurants within a short walking distance. The original grand building is now a shadow of its former self. Decorated throughout with woodchip and magnolia. Dingy corridors and public areas. One temperamental lift. My large room on the 4th floor was VERY basic – scratched furniture, nylon pillows/sheets, faded counterpane, lumpy mattress; a 1970’s no remote TV, no hangers, curtains, seating or air conditioning. Strong whiff of air freshener to cover lingering cigarette smoke. The bathroom had been upgraded some time ago but water pressure/heat was barely adequate. Towels had seen better days! Very noisy 24/7 looking onto the C.Seville with a constant flow of traffic. The personal security instructions for guest safety quite intimidating! The continental style breakfast in the 1st floor dining room was more than adequate. Additional bread/coffee was available on request from the extremely friendly and efficient waiting staff. Despite the poor standard of maintenance and decoration, the hotel was very popular and at the time of my stay must have had 100’s of guests. No doubt – like me attracted by the cheap room rates! Oh and the Location, Location, Location!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1radders
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights but hotel was fine and suitable for our needs although bar did not seem to open (enough bars locally anyway). Great position in the heart of Madrid although if in outfacing room lots of noise and suggest using earplugs.Infacing rooms are a bit dark but are cleaned everyday. Breakfast nothing special but ok. Overall hotel was fine and would certainly stay there again. IAN RADLEY

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned/demolished”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: Despite the cheaper price & hotel blurb on the website we booked through, i'd have to say that our stay here was awful. I've stayed in better 1 star & hostel accomodation than this supposedly 3star hotel. The floors & ceilings are rotting & slope down on a sickening angle so that when you go to bed you feel as though you'll wake up at the other end of the room or buried in the rubble of the collapsed hotel. The multiple locks on the door made us feel as though perhaps we were in an unsafe area of town and the lack of airconditioning meant that the room was stifling, and opening the double glazed windows to let some air in defeats the purpose as made room noisy too. Perhaps nicest feature of hotel was our bathroom which was recently renovated we think & the breakfast which was simple (like airline food) but edible. I'm sorry to not be able to recommend this hotel & our other 2 Madrid hotels made us realise that for the same price you can get excellent accomodation which was palatial in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely lower end of 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Clarkey01
Reviews.Content: Despite hotel website staing they had air conditioning (assumption that this would be in the rooms), this is not correct so with its central location - very noisy! No water of power at various times during stay and staff not at all helpful to the point of rudeness. Suggest this would be a good stay for those backpacking - very central - although expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott007
Reviews.Content: Cheap, friendly and central hotel. It is not the Ritz but is worth every penny! Very Spanish - traditional. This is a city central hotel so it is very noisy outside. However, this is what madrid is all aobut - traffic jams at 4am! I went last summer and I am sure the room had air con? Would book again here - Madrid is a great city. The metro is great and very easy to use Pickpockets???????????? Nah!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: bambina143
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old, it smelled horrible as we walked in. I thought that it would have air conditioning in the room, which it didn't. They had air in a hallway downstairs and they turned the air off at 10 pm. In the room there was a small fan, that barely worked and when I requested another fan, they said they did not have any. We were in the 1st floor and had a window that opened to an inside patio, where the kitchen to the restaurant was. It was HORRIBLE, specially when the temperature those days in MAdrid was over 100 degrees. We requested a taxi at 4:00 am to the airport to catch our flight home, the staff said to walk around the corner and wait for one to pass by. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as expected from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel with friends for a 40th birthday celebrations. We were all very sceptical having read the reviews, however pleasantly surprised. I was in a triple room on the 6th floor. There was no unpleasant smell. The room was quite spacious and all the beds were quite comfortable. We did not experience any excessive noisethrougout the night, however it was still quite cool at night and were able to close the windows and shutters. We could here a small amount of noise and imagine that when the windows are open in the hot weather it would be very noisy. But that would apply in all the hotels in the centre. The rooms were old fashioned but quite spacious and clean. The staff were very friendly and willing to help. There is a mini bus which you can book for your return trip to the airport, I cannot remember how much it was but it was really good value, and very efficient. We only ate breakfast, but we found it ideal. They serve it to you-continental style breakfast. You also have access to cereal, and the tea and coffee is forever flowing. It us ideally situated right in the heart of Madrids nightlife, and as stated by other reviewers is an ideal base if your only using it to sleep. I recommend the open-topped bus trip of the city. this hotel is classed as a 2 star so you can only expect that, but my friends and myself had a brilliant weekend. We had no problems with pick pockets. However we were very careful with our money and we did not use the metro. I would highly recommend the plaza Mayor for Tapas and drinking sangria-very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid a great city”
Reviews.Author: carla188590
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 7 other female friends and we checked out on the 17/5/2006. The Asturias Hotel which is very central and the location is great. We enjoyed the breakfast and evening meal. We couldn't complain about the amount which were given and for people with big appetite this is a must. The rooms are very clean but look a bit tired and could do with a splash of paint. Only when you do book, avoid the 5th floor as studends, teenagers, stag and hen partys are being accomodated there. It is very noisy, and although the staff are very helpful, after a couple of nights without sleep it becomes very tiresome and it could spoil your stay. Ask for the first or second floor and hopefuly you will be ok. Madrid is a great city so enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Basic amenities but does the job”
Reviews.Author: KDuncan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night trip to Madrid (9/5/06 to11/5/06) where we stayed at the Asturias Hotel. The hotel is situated in a very central location near to many shops and restaurants and only a 2 min walk from the Metro station Sevilla. Most of the major tourist attractions are within walking distance. The facilities at the hotel are very basic as its 2 star grading suggests. The room was clean, the beds comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The service at the hotel was good. The towels were changed every day. The furniture was old. Being in the centre of town it could get noisy at night. During our stay the crowds only made a lot of noise on one night when there seemed to be some sort of celebration going on. There is only one lift in the hotel which could mean a bit of a wait especially if you were allocated a room on one of the upper floors. We were on the 3rd floor. The breakfast was continental style, served by a waiter and it was fine. On the whole we enjoyed our trip and did not regret staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not as Bad as Listed!!!”
Reviews.Author: chickencurry007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel if you are using it just as a base and a place to sleep. Like some of the other reviews, I agree, it's in a great location. It's located just off the Sevilla metro stop. You turn the corner, and there it is. It's also within walking distance of the Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Palacio Real. I had a hotel on the 5th floor, and unlike some previous listings, it was not that bad. It was a large room (with 2 twin beds). The bathroom ws large and clean. I do agree that the walls are very thin and the street noise is loud. But, perhaps that's just the way Madrelenos are. I walked a lot the first day and fell right asleep. I was up early, so the cleaning service didn't affect me either. Overall, I would stay here again (45 GBP on expedia.co.uk). Great location, good room.

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: Livia P
Reviews.Content: Well...the Asturias had been a really good bargain.. in the sense that we had paid 60 Euros per night per room ( double ). The location is fantastic, just a walk from the Puerta del Sol, in the very centre of the city. I knew there must be something bad which should compensate the price. It wasn't the size of the room, which was pretty spacious and in spite of the old fashoned furniture, not too bad. The place seemed quite secure and quite clean. Bathrooms are o.k. as well. Breakfast is basic but not miserable - after all..if you need something more there is plenty of coffe bars in the surroundings. The thing which was not working at all is that the hotel, on the whole, is terribly noisy. The personnel cleaning the rooms in the morning is really disturbing, passing to and fro in front of the rooms with all their stuff clattering and hitting everywhere. So, if you're not completely dead, forget about waking up later than 08.30 a.m.. Besides, one night they decided to work at some water pipe in the building. We had been advised there won't have been any water during the night...and that was not a problem. The problem was they were materially working at those pipes...with an hammer at 1 in the night. What can I say: be prepared...this is one of those places you can chose to save money. If this is your aim, the place is yours. If you are looking for a more comfortable place...well, don't complain about it...you're advised...

Reviews.Title: “Great for seeing Madrid, but get a low floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: kersmeister
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cetralised hotel, which you don't plan to stay in during the day, then this hotel does the job fine. We stayed here for three nights 27th to 30th Jan 06. I had read the below reviews and was terrified I'd chosen a demolition site for my fiancee's christmas present!!!!!! As it turned out, it was fine. Not great, but fine. The hotel was fantastically positioned, just off the 'sevilla' metro stop (which by the way you need to be careful when using, my fiancee was pick pocketed whilst travelling on this trip, 150euros taken...secure your handbags ladies, or you'll spend 3 hours of your holiday in the police station like we did!!!!). 6.15euros for 10 trip ticket on the metro lasted all holiday, mainly due to the convenience of the location. It's right next to the 'sol' so fantastic for shopping and drinks out. The Royal Palace and the Prado Museum are 10 mins walk. Cafe's are all around, Starbucks being about 100yards away! We had always planned to use it just for sleeping and as a base, so for us it was just what we needed. I would say, if you don't like noise, don't stay in Asturias (or any of the central hotels!). At night you will hear the horns and shouts that seem to be customary of spanish driving! Also, get a low floor. The hotel was good until about the 3rd floor. This was our floor and from the stairs between 2nd and 3rd floors upwards there was a funny smell, quite unpleasant. It was like the drains were blocked. This was by no means unbearable, and was somewhat compensated by a good view from our small balcony, but it just would have been a 4/5 rating if it hadn't been there. The breakfast was ok, again nothing special, but for the price you just can't complain! There are however a couple of handy hints I would like to pass on to you: 1)If it's the only spanish you use, say 'hola' instead of 'hello', the initial response you get seems to make it far more acceptable to speak english afterwards. The hotel staff are very friendly once the effort of that single word is made. 2)Bring proper tea bags and take them to breakfast...the hotel is not accustomed to english tea, but the milk and sugar will make a good cuppa! 3)Be prepared to struggle massively if you are a vegetarian, choices are very limited for decent food in your average restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic backpacker style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in madrid over New year 2006. The Hotel was very very basic and reminded me of 2 star backpacker style hotel in India/ Thailand etc. The lift is useless and the whole hotel needs a lick of paint and some NEW SHEETS. Our sheets weren't changed once whilst we were there and the dust in the room was an inch thick! GREAT LOCATION though, the best part of Madrid, suitable for boys in groups or non fussy backpackers on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Never go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever been in. We were due to stay 3 nights but only managed 1. The bathroom was falling apart, the room was dark, the room door did not lock, basically it should be knocked down! Never again.
